Players scrapped on the pitch and in the tunnel, and while Atletico were deemed the aggressors, Eurosport Spain's Samuel Garcia says all involved were to blame.

Contents: Despite achieving a respectable second-place finish in his first season at the club, silverware has ultimately alluded Matic at Old Trafford. He was unable to add to the two Premier League titles, FA Cup and League Cup that he won during his more successful spell at Chelsea. The closest he came to a trophy in Manchester was in last year's Europa League final.

Content_title: By beating Atletico Madrid at their own game, Manchester City have blueprint to finally win Champions League
Contents: The hard work and hassle involved in beating a gritty and cynical Atletico Madrid team is beyond many sides. However Pep Guardiola's Manchester City team were able to play them at their own game, keeping them at arm's length and holding onto a slim lead for most of a two-leg tie. The manner of victory sets them up for success in the competition's remaining games.

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp praises 'top world level player' Luis Diaz after goal and assist earns Liverpool win at Benfica

Chelsea had 70 per cent possession against Juventus and Tuchel is not quite sure why his team could not get on the scoresheet.

While many are understandably excited about what the Dutchman can bring to Old Trafford, it is worth remembering that more than one manager with an impressive CV has been unable to succeed at the club.

Content_title: Liverpool sign Portugal winger Diogo Jota from Wolves
Contents: Liverpool have signed Diogo Jota from Wolverhampton Wanderers with the 23-year-old Portuguese international forward the champions' second signing in quick succession after Thiago Alcantara arrived on Friday from Bayern Munich.

Content_title: Dejan Lovren joins FC Zenit from Liverpool
Contents: Dejan Lovren has joined FC Zenit after leaving Premier League champions Liverpool.

Content_title: Wolves confirm Ki-Jana Hoever signing from Liverpool
Contents: Wolves have announced the signing of 18-year-old Dutch defender Ki-Jana Hoever from Premier League champions Liverpool for a fee thought to be worth around £10 million. Diogo Jota is set to move in the opposite direction.

Content_title: Manchester City clinch signing of Ferran Torres
Contents: Manchester City have completed the signing of Ferran Torres from Valencia.

Content_title: Manchester City confirm Nathan Ake signing
Contents: Manchester City have confirmed the capture of Nathan Ake from Bournemouth for a fee believed be worth up to £41 million.

Content_title: Manchester City confirm Ruben Dias signing, with Nicolas Otamendi joining Benfica as part of deal
Contents: Manchester City have signed Ruben Dias from Benfica, with Nicolas Otamendi heading in the other direction as part of the deal. The 23-year-old is reported to have cost £62m and becomes City's third summer signing after Ferran Torres and Nathan Ake.

Content_title: Leroy Sane completes Bayern Munich move
Contents: Leroy Sane has completed his much-anticipated move from Manchester City to Bayern Munich.

Content_title: Former Man City midfielder David Silva signs for Real Sociedad
Contents: Former Manchester City midfielder David Silva has signed for La Liga side Real Sociedad after he left the English club.

Content_title: Manchester United confirm Donny van de Beek signing from Ajax
Contents: Manchester United have finally confirmed the Dutchman's arrival.

Content_title: Man United agree deal to sign teenage winger Amad Diallo Traore
Contents: Manchester United have agreed a deal to sign Atalanta forward Amad Diallo Traoré. The winger has played just 25 minutes of Serie A football but is regarded as an exceptional prospect, and United may have to spend around £40 million should he be a success at Old Trafford.

Content_title: Alex Telles: Manchester United sign Porto left-back
Contents: Manchester United have signed Porto left-back Alex Telles, the Premier League club have announced. The Brazil international has signed a contract until 2024, with an option for a further year. The Old Trafford club are also said to be closing in on a deal for Uruguay striker Edinson Cavani, who is available on a free after leaving PSG.

Content_title: Manchester United confirm Edinson Cavani deal in late flurry of activity
Contents: Former Paris Saint-Germain striker Edinson Cavani has joined Manchester United on a permanent deal after failing to find another club in the transfer window. The 33-year-old Uruguayan international is set to offer support to Anthony Martial and Odion Ighalo in attack.

Content_title: Alexis Sanchez leaves Manchester United for Inter Milan on a three-year deal
Contents: Alexis Sanchez has joined Inter Milan from Manchester United on a three-year contract, both clubs have announced.

Content_title: Dean Henderson v David de Gea the ‘next chapter’ as Aaron Ramsdale joins Sheff Utd
Contents: Dean Henderson bid farewell to Sheffield United on the same day the Blades confirmed the arrival of Aaron Ramsdale from Bournemouth.

Content_title: Sheffield United announce signing of Rhian Brewster from Liverpool for £23 million
Contents: Sheffield United have broken their transfer record to sign Rhian Brewster from Liverpool. The England under-21 international has reportedly cost around £23 million and Jurgen Klopp's side are believed to have a buyback clause that lasts for the next three years.

Content_title: Tottenham confirm signing of Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg from Southampton
Contents: Tottenham have confirmed the signing of Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg from fellow Premier League side Southampton.

Content_title: Tottenham sign right back Matt Doherty from Wolves
Contents: Jose Mourinho continues a strong transfer window for the club.

Content_title: Gareth Bale completes sensational return to Tottenham
Contents: Gareth Bale has completed a sensational return to Tottenham as Jose Mourinho adds some much-needed firepower to his strikeforce. The Wales international joins the club on a one-year load deal.

Content_title: Tottenham confirm Sergio Reguilon signing from Real Madrid
Contents: Tottenham Hotspur have confirmed the signing of Sergio Reguilón from Real Madrid. The Spain international has signed a deal that runs until 2025 and will wear the number three shirt.

Content_title: West Ham sign Czech midfielder Tomas  Soucek on permanent deal
Contents: West Ham United have signed Czech Republic midfielder Tomas Soucek from Slavia Prague on a four-year contract after a successful loan spell, the Premier League club said on Friday.

Content_title: Wolves smash club record to sign Fabio Silva from Porto
Contents: Wolves have signed the 18-year-old for more than they paid for Raul Jimenez.

Content_title: Nelson Semedo joins Wolves from Barcelona in £37m deal
Contents: Nelson Semedo has joined Wolves in a deal worth around £37m from Barcelona, the La Liga club have announced. The Portugal international is widely expected to replace the departed Matt Doherty in their right wing-back role in the starting XI.

Content_title: 'We have to play better' - Jurgen Klopp says Liverpool could have done better in 5-0 win away to Manchester United
Contents: Liverpool’s manager Jurgen Klopp said his side should have played even better in their 5-0 thrashing of Manchester United at Old Trafford. Speaking ahead of the Reds' next game against Brighton, Klopp said they had relied on luck and their goalkeeper, Alisson Becker, to avoid conceding against the Red Devils.

Content_title: Football news - Tottenham Hotspur 'call off pursuit' for Antonio Conte as new manager - reports
Contents: Former Chelsea and Inter Milan manager Antonio Conte had been rumoured to be Spurs' choice to replace Ryan Mason as manager in the close season. However multiple journalists have now claimed that the pursuit of the Italian manager has hit rocky ground with Conte unconvinced that a job in North London is what he wants.

Content_title: 'Jose wasn’t happy but there was nothing I could do!' – Eric Dier on leaving the pitch
Contents: Eric Dier left the pitch in the second half and he explained that when nature calls there’s nothing that can be done. His manager also had a laugh about it but was full of praise for the performance that his player put in after playing twice in 48 hours as Spurs deal with a congested fixture schedule.

Content_title: Mason Mount misses crucial spot-kick as Spurs beat Chelsea on penalties
Contents: EFL Cup Fourth Round, Tottenham Hotspur Stadium – Tottenham Hotspur 1 (Lamela 84’) Chelsea 1 (Werner 19’) Spurs win 5-4 on penalties

Content_title: Liverpool's Thiago Alcantara self-isolating after positive Covid-19 test
Contents: Liverpool have announced that new signing Thiago Alcantara, who missed Monday's win over Arsenal, has tested positive for Covid-19. The club say he is "currently self-isolating according to the necessary guidelines” and has “exhibited minor symptoms of the virus but is in good health and is getting better”.

Content_title: August 10 deadline? Jadon Sancho to Man Utd – What we know so far
Contents: Jadon Sancho’s move to Manchester United appears to be edging closer, although reports on Monday suggest Borussia Dortmund have set a deadline for the transfer - is there a twist in this drawn-out tale?

Content_title: Liverpool's deal for Fulham's teenage Portuguese midfielder Fabio Carvalho is 'close' - report
Contents: Having been moments away from a transfer in January, a five-year contract taking19-year-old Fabio Carvalho to Anfield from Championship leaders Fulham is reportedly near to being completed. Carvalho - who recently made his debut for Portugal's under-21 team - has attracted attention with his displays since bursting into the first team at Craven Cottage.

Content_title: Barcelona weigh up summer transfer options, and don’t rule out Luis Enrique to Man Utd - Paper Round
Contents: Barcelona want Erling Haaland but would happily settle on Robert Lewandowski or Mohamed Salah in the summer transfer window, while Luis Enrique is being linked with the Manchester United job. Elsewhere, Leeds have set a price tag on Barca target Raphinha, and Premier League referees could start training with clubs next season to boost the relationship between players and officials.

Content_title: Premier League result - Manchester United woes continue as Anthony Gordon gives Everton crucial win
Contents: Premier League, Goodison Park - Everton 1 (Gordon 26') Manchester United 0

Content_title: Man Utd players say things on international duty, episode 247, ft. Luke Shaw and regular Paul Pogba – The Warm-Up
Contents: Comments from Manchester United players while on international duty will feel like a slap in the face for the club’s hierarchy. Yes, that was a mild Oscars reference. Anyway, there’s also a good day for WSL, a monthlong wait for Chelsea, and the football moment of the year – quite probably – from Christian Eriksen.

Content_title: Man Utd dressing room split on Erik ten Hag, Real Madrid want to loan out Eden Hazard – Paper Round
Contents: Tuesday’s Paper Round leads on reports Manchester United’s dressing room is split on the possibility of Ajax boss Erik ten Hag taking charge at Old Trafford. There’s also Eden Hazard reportedly being loaned out by Real Madrid next season, Tottenham looking to make Dejan Kulusevski’s move permanent, and news on Kalvin Phillips’ contract at Leeds.

Content_title: Manchester United 'hold talks' with Ismaila Sarr, but it would be a gamble
Contents: Manchester United are interested in signing Ismaila Sarr from Watford, according to reports. Sarr joined Watford for a club-record fee of £30m in August 2019 and is currently playing in the Championship following the Hornets' relegation.

Content_title: Eden Hazard set to miss Chelsea return in Champions League with Real Madrid after undergoing surgery
Contents: Eden Hazard's injury-hit spell at Real Madrid has continued as he has undergone surgery that could rule him out for a month. Hazard, 31, has had a plate removed from his leg and is not expected to be available to face former club Chelsea in the quarter-finals of the Champions League. Hazard has made just 65 appearances for the La Liga leaders after signing in 2019.

Content_title: Arsena face summer transfer battle for Wolves' Ruben Neves and PSV striker Cody Gakpo - Paper Round
Contents: Arsenal hope to sign Ruben Neves from Wolves, while they might find it difficult to secure Cody Gakpo from PSV Eindhoven if he stops playing through the middle to get a World Cup spot with the Netherlands. Elsewhere, Real Madrid may be stuck with Eden Hazard, and Chelsea's preferred bidders are confirmed.

Content_title: 'I have done what I had to do' - Gerard Pique had no hesitation in taking pay reduction to help his Barcelona 'family'
Contents: “I was born and raised here,” Gerard Pique said following the club’s 4-2 win over Real Sociedad. “I have done what I had to do with the wage reduction."  Pique opened the scoring in the 4-2 win on Sunday, and the defender will hope the club can put the issues of the summer behind them and challenge for honours in the post-Messi era.

Content_title: Zinedine Zidane not interested in new Real Madrid transfers
Contents: Real Madrid coach Zinedine Zidane says he does not want to sign any more players before the transfer window shuts, even after his side looked short on firepower in their 0-0 draw at Real Sociedad in last week's season opener.

Content_title: Controversial Sergio Ramos Panenka seals Real Madrid victory against ten-man Real Betis
Contents: La Liga, Estadio Benito Villamarin – Real Betis 2 (Mandi 35’, Carvalho 37’) Real Madrid 3 (Valverde 14’, Emerson (OG) 48’, Ramos (P) 82’)

Content_title: Memphis Depay among players registered by Barcelona as club legend Gerard Pique takes substantial pay cut
Contents: Barcelona’s summer arrivals are officially available for La Liga action after registration, as the club struggles to deal with a hefty wage bill. Lionel Messi’s departure has helped free up funds, as talks of a salary reduction for Sergio Busquets and Jordi Alba are ongoing, the club confirmed.

Content_title: Real Madrid deny claims club president Florentino Perez wants to quit La Liga for move to Premier League
Contents: Los Blancos boss Florentino Perez has reportedly explored the option of a possible switch to the Premier League after rows between the club and La Liga continue. In an official statement the club have strongly denied any chance of a move and claim rumours are ‘false, absurd and impossible’ as Perez is understood to be furious with La Liga officials.

Content_title: Barcelona, Real Madrid, Juventus? Where should Paul Pogba go to rebuild his career in the summer?
Contents: After opening up about his mental health and with no new contract on the horizon it seems more likely than ever that Paul Pogba will leave Manchester United in the summer. Pete Sharland takes a look at the different clubs who will be interested in signing the France midfielder, and which one would suit the World Cup winner best.

Content_title: Liverpool ease past Arsenal, new signing Diogo Jota nets debut Reds goal
Contents: Premier League, Anfield - Liverpool 3 (Mane 28', Robertson 34', Jota 88') Arsenal 1 (Lacazette 25')

Content_title: Frank Lampard refuses to discuss Chelsea links, other Premier League managers extend sympathy over Ukraine
Contents: Premier League managers have expressed sympathy over the invasion of Ukraine by Russia, on president Vladimir Putin's orders. Pep Guardiola, Ralf Rangnick and David Moyes all discussed the situation. Manchester City's Oleksandr Zinchenko, West Ham's Andriy Yarmolenko and Everton's Vitalii Mykolenko are all from Ukraine.

Content_title: N'Golo Kante to Manchester United: Could surprise swoop be just what Ole Gunnar Solskjaer needs?
Contents: After Manchester United got away with one, and some, on Saturday at Brighton, the club are looking at ways to strengthen a fragile defence, with Chelsea's N'Golo Kante emerging as a shock option.

Content_title: Chelsea showed spirit but it’s time they showed some common sense
Contents: After watching Chelsea’s chaotic performance against West Bromwich Albion, Pete Sharland wonders when they’re going to wake up and realise what is happening.

Content_title: Tottenham manager Antonio Conte: Premier League defeat to Wolves 'one of the best games we played'
Contents: Despite losing 2-0 to Wolverhampton Wanderers - his side's third consecutive loss - Tottenham manager Antonio Conte was happy with his side's effort and commitment in their Premier League game on Sunday afternoon. However he acknowledged it would take time to turnaround his side's form after months of struggle.

Content_title: Jesse Lingard given time off and will miss Middlesbrough tie, explains Manchester United boss Ralf Rangnick
Contents: Manchester United and England forward Jesse Lingard asked Ralf Rangnick for time off following his failure to leave the club in the January transfer window despite interest in the playmaker from various clubs. Club boss Ralf Rangnick gave him the go-ahead to miss the next couple of days and will not face Middlsbrough this Friday.

Contents: Premier League, The Hawthorns – West Bromwich Albion 3 (Robinson 4’, 25’, Bartley 27’) Chelsea 3 (Mount 55’, Hudson-Odoi 70’, Abraham 90+3’)

Content_title: Ballon d’Or 2022 - Lionel Messi, Kylian Mbappe and Robert Lewandowski chances of winning award examined
Contents: This year’s World Cup in Qatar will take place after the presentation of this year’s award, and the players’ exploits in that tournament will be judged for the following year. But despite a number of fundamental for this year's award, the usual suspects are set to battle it out once again to receive what is arguably the most respected individual award in world football.

Content_title: Cristiano Ronaldo phone incident: Mother of teenage fan claims Manchester United star ‘assaulted’ her son
Contents: Manchester United lost to Everton in the Premier League on Saturday to dent their hopes of securing a place in the top four, but the post-game talk is all about Cristiano Ronaldo after he appeared to hit a phone out of the hands of a spectator when walking off the Goodison Park pitch at full-time. Ronaldo has since apologised on Instagram for his “outburst”.

Content_title: Ballon d’Or - A number of major changes to award have been confirmed, to come into play from 2022 onwards
Contents: The Ballon d’Or will be awarded on a seasonal basis. Also, an even stronger list of nominees for the award will be comprised. The list of men’s players from L'Équipe and France Football journalists will be added to those from Ballon d’Or ambassador Didier Drogba. This also applies to the Kopa (best performing men’s player under 21) and Yashin (best performing goalkeeper) trophies.

Content_title: Ballon d’Or 2022: Kevin De Bruyne should be favourite, but the fact he isn’t is a testament to Man City team-mates
Contents: Karim Benzema, Robert Lewandowski, Mohamed Salah and Kylian Mbappe are the quartet currently leading the way with the bookmakers when it comes to the Ballon d’Or. Sitting sixth with the bookies is a certain Kevin De Bruyne, the best player within the squad of the Champions League favourites. What does that say about the award? Or is that simply a compliment to City?

Content_title: ‘He’s ready to win the Ballon d’Or!’ – Spain reacts to sensational Karim Benzema and Real Madrid
Contents: After Karim Benzema’s sensational performance in the first leg of Real Madrid’s quarter-final Champions League clash with Chelsea, Pete Sharland gets in touch with Felix Martin to talk about the Frenchman’s hat-trick in the 3-1 win for Real and what he made of the Blues as well as the commanding lead that Real have taken.

Content_title: Wayne Rooney responds to Cristiano Ronaldo 'jealous' accusation after criticisms of Manchester United star
Contents: Manchester United great Wayne Rooney has laughed off Cristiano Ronaldo’s reaction to his criticism of the forward, who accused the former England captain of being “jealous” of him. While working as a pundit on Sky Sports, Rooney said Ronaldo’s return to Old Trafford had not worked out.

Content_title: Antonio Conte says top four is 'life changing' for Tottenham as they battle Arsenal for Champions League
Contents: Tottenham have won their last four games in a row to move into pole position in the battle for fourth place in the Premier League ahead of Arsenal. Spurs are looking to qualify for the Champions League for the first time since the 2019/20 season and are three points ahead of the Gunners. Manager Antonio Conte says it's "very important" to finish in the top four.

Content_title: Pep Guardiola says he was upset at not being invited on Jack Grealish's night out with Manchester City team-mates
Contents: With a degree of irony, Pep Guardiola said Jack Grealish, Kyle Walker and Riyad Mahrez would be fined for not inviting him on their night out on Sunday. The trio were pictured roaming the streets of Manchester with Grealish in particular looking worse for wear. But Guardiola seemed unbothered by what he'd seen. City face Brentford on Wednesday night at the Etihad Stadium.

Content_title: ‘We never expected £100m to be met’ – Aston Villa boss Dean Smith discusses Jack Grealish’s transfer to Manchester City
Contents: Grealish scored six and assisted ten across 26 Premier League apperances for Villa last season, before featuring for Gareth Southgate's England at Euro 2020. The midfielder came on as a substitute to make his debut for Manchester City in their Community Shield defeat to Leicester, wherein the Citizens fell to a late penalty from former striker Kelechi Iheanacho.

Content_title: Euro 2020 - 'Right thing to do' - Gary Neville gives verdict on Jack Grealish substitution in extra-time v Denmark
Contents: Gary Neville believes Jack Grealish will have no complaints about his substitution in extra-time against Denmark, even if he is probably embarrassed to be a subbed sub. Grealish was hooked after Harry Kane put England in front and Neville praised Gareth Southgate over the call. “He’ll make the decisions that need to be made for the team to be successful and he puts the team first," he said.

Content_title: Manchester City reach semi-finals after bruising goalless draw away at ten-man Atletico Madrid
Contents: Champions League quarter-final second leg, Wanda Metropolitano – Atletico Madrid 0 Manchester City 0 (Manchester City win 1-0 on aggregate)

Content_title: 'Diego Simeone can play the way he wants' – Pep Guardiola claims he has never criticised Atletico Madrid
Contents: Manchester City reached the Champions League semi-finals after an unfamiliar rear-guard display against Atletico Madrid. Leading 1-0 from the first leg thanks to a Kevin De Bruyne strike, City survived a stern examination from the Spanish champions to earn a goalless draw in the Wanda Metropolitano Stadium. Pep Guardiola’s side will face Real Madrid in the last four.

Content_title: Atletico Madrid 0-0 Manchester City: Football with agg > football without agg - The Warm-Up
Contents: Manchester City and Atletico Madrid contested a testy affair on Wednesday and it was a masterpiece. Next up for City will be Liverpool, whose boss Jurgen Klopp said someone could “knock him out” if he showed discontent at ever progressing from a quarter-final of the Champions League. And did Manchester United players veto a spot in the Champions League?

Contents: Estadio da Luz, Champions League quarter-final first leg - Benfica 1 (Nunez 49') Liverpool 3 (Konate 17' Mane 34' Diaz 87')

Content_title: 'That's all I need' - Jurgen Klopp content with Mohamed Salah's contract talks with Liverpool
Contents: With a contract that expires at the end of the 2022/23 season, Liverpool are running out of time to sign a new deal with forward Mohamed Salah before they have to consider selling him in the summer to avoid losing him for nothing. However speaking to the press, Jurgen Klopp is content with how talks are going over the matter.

Content_title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp 'couldn't care less' about Manchester City against Burnley game
Contents: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp called on his supporters to produce the best atmosphere ever for a Saturday game as his side prepare to take on Watford, with a win able to send them top, for a few hours at least. He claimed that he had no interest in the game to follow, when Manchester City take on Burnley.

Contents: St Mary's, Premier League - Southampton 0 Chelsea 6 (Alonso 8' Mount 16' 54' Werner 21' 49' Havertz 31')

Contents: Champions League Group H, Juventus Stadium – Juventus 1 (Chiesa 46’) Chelsea 0

Content_title: Opinion: Where will Barcelona's sorry fall from grace end after shock Champions League defeat to Benfica
Contents: Ronald Koeman's side suffered another damaging defeat in the Champions League which will only increase the pressure on the Barcelona manager. The Catalan club have grown accustomed to humiliation on the continental stage in recent years, but there's no guarantee that they won't fall even further. These are bleak times at the Camp Nou.

Contents: Juventus Stadium, Champions League last 16 - Juventus 2 (Ronaldo 43' pen., 60') Lyon 1 (Depay 12' pen.)

Contents: Etihad Stadium, Champions League last 16 - Manchester City 2 (Sterling 9', Jesus 68') Real Madrid 1 (Benzema 28')

Content_title: Real Madrid's 'confidence overdose' almost cost them against Chelsea in Champions League epic - Inside Europe
Contents: Following their win at Stamford Bridge, Real Madrid were expected to see out the tie in the home leg against the holders. Instead, Chelsea almost pulled off a stunning comeback – only to be denied as Rodrygo forced extra time late on, then Karim Benzema headed the hosts into the semis. Felix Martin takes us through a remarkable night in which Real emerged on top despite being far from their best.

Content_title: Barcelona must give up La Liga ambitions to focus on Europa League success and build team for next season
Contents: Barcelona must hope they can overcome Eintracht Frankfurt on Thursday evening in their Europa League tie, with the Germans securing a 1-1 draw in the first leg. While Xavi Hernandez might be tempted to chase down both a European trophy and La Liga this season, it may be more sensible for him to leave the title to foes Real Madrid to focus on bringing home another trophy this season.

Content_title: Atletico Madrid 'among the few teams in Europe who can beat Manchester City' - Inside Europe
Contents: The quarter-finals of the Champions League are upon us and among the mouth-watering ties thrown up, favourites Manchester City take on Atletico Madrid. Diego Simeone's side travel to the Etihad first as underdogs but have a history of upsetting the odds in the competition. Eurosport Spain's Felix Martin breaks down how they are shaping up ahead of the tie.

Content_title: ‘He’ll always try and rocket it!’ – Benfica dangerman Darwin Nunez, the forward everyone wants to sign
Contents: Ahead of their Champions League clash against Liverpool Pete Sharland looks at Benfica forward Darwin Nunez. With the help of Tom Kundert from Portugoal and Aaron Barton of Proxima Jornada, Sharland analyses the strengths and weaknesses of Nunez's game, as well as which team might be the best fit when he eventually moves in the summer.

Content_title: Ballon d'Or 2022 - Zlatan Ibrahimovic believes he never won the Ballon d'Or because he's not 'Mr Perfect'
Contents: Zlatan Ibrahimovic's illustrious career over the past two decades has seen him win major honours all across Europe. However, he's never gotten his hands on the coveted Ballon d'Or. The reason? He thinks it's because he doesn't fit the perfect mould that previous winners Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi have.

Content_title: Austrian FA 'didn't meet' Manchester United boss Ralf Rangnick about their vacant manager's job
Contents: The Austrian FA have denied reports they met Manchester United boss Ralf Rangnick about their vacant manager's job. Austrian outlet Kurier claimed that a meeting had taken place between Rangnick and the Austrian FA's sports director Peter Schottel in Manchester on Monday. Previous Austria coach Franco Foda left his post last month following his side's failure to reach the World Cup.

Content_title: Tottenham Covid outbreak: Manager Antonio Conte says players and staff are ‘scared’ as situation worsens
Contents: A reported eight cases of Covid has risen to 13 in the Tottenham camp, with Antonio Conte confirming eight players and five members of staff have tested positive. Spurs are due to play Rennes in the Europa Conference League on Thursday and Brighton in the Premier League on Sunday. "Everyone is a bit scared. People have families,” said Conte.

Content_title: PSG defender Sergio Ramos says he wants to continue playing for 'four or five more years' despite injuries
Contents: PSG defender Sergio Ramos says he wants to continue playing for "four or five more years" despite suffering with a chronic calf injury this term. The Spaniard - now 36 - has struggled to make any sort of impact in the French capital having moved there from Real Madrid last summer, but he is optimistic he can get his body right again and extend his glittering career.

Content_title: 'It's the mouth that kills the fish' - Diego Simeone silent in face of Pep Guardiola barbs ahead of Atletico v Man City
Contents: Atletico Madrid boss Diego Simeone chose to remain silent in the face of criticism of his methods ahead of his side's Champions League second leg against Manchester City. Neither would 'El Cholo' be drawn into attacking City boss Pep Guardiola and said that his side would take a similar tactical approach in Wednesday night's tie to their defensive first-leg display.

Content_title: Mikel Arteta disappointed with 'sloppy' Arsenal after Brighton defeat hits Champions League hopes
Contents: Defeat to Crystal Palace earlier in the week had meant that Arsenal needed a win over Brighton to make sure they did not lose control of the race for a Champions League spot, but a home loss to Brighton meant that they gave Tottenham the chance to move ahead - a mistake that Mikel Arteta described as 'sloppy'.

Content_title: Mikel Arteta shuts down Antonio Conte mind games with focus on Arsenal's top-four hopes ahead of Crystal Palace clash
Contents: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta said Arsenal's clear objectives and that outside noise is not going to distract them from their challenge for the top four, which continues with a trip to Patrick Vieira's Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park on Monday night. The Gunners dropped to fifth place after Spurs victory over Newcastle on Sunday but will reclaim fourth spot if they avoid defeat across the capital.

Content_title: Marcus Rashford and Fikayo Tomori in? The 23 England players who should be on the plane to Qatar for World Cup 2022
Contents: With eight months to go until the World Cup in Qatar, Gareth Southgate has some big decisions to make on the final shape of his 23-man squad for the tournament. While his thinking will no doubt be influenced by club form and international performances in the interim, there are several players who didn’t feature during this international break who ought to get a look in.

Content_title: Manchester United manager Ralf Rangnick praises 'very valuable' Harry Maguire after midweek boos with England team
Contents: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire was described by his club coach Ralf Rangnick as a 'very valuable player' to the team, and suggested that players such as Maguire, Fred and Scott McTominay often come in for unfair criticism. Maguire was booed by England fans during the midweek friendly against Ivory Coast.

Content_title: 'So much more I want to achieve' - Bruno Fernandes signs new Manchester United deal until at least 2026
Contents: Bruno Fernandes has committed his long-term future to Manchester United by agreeing to a new contract which keeps him at the Premier League club until 2026. His contract includes an option to extend for a further year. The Portugal international has scored 49 goals and contributed 39 assists in 117 games for United since arriving from Sporting Lisbon in January 2020.

Content_title: Burnley sack Sean Dyche in bombshell move as Clarets battle for Premier League survival
Contents: Burnley delivered a bombshell on Friday by dismissing Sean Dyche. The Clarets are four points adrift of safety in the Premier League with eight games remaining following the 2-0 defeat to Norwich City. Assistant manager Ian Woan, first-team coach Steve Stone and goalkeeping coach Billy Mercer have also departed Turf Moor. Meanwhile, Jurgen Klopp takes as the Premier League's longest-serving boss.

Content_title: Thomas Partey injury ‘significant’ - Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta
Contents: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says Thomas Partey’s injury is “significant” and will not confirm whether he will play again this season, after the Ghana midfielder came off with a thigh problem during Monday’s Premier League defeat to Crystal Palace. Arteta has also backed Nuno Tavares to bounce back from another embarrassing substitution.

Content_title: Arsenal, Tottenham, Manchester United and the battle to make a mockery of the ‘Champions’ League – The Warm-Up
Contents: Arsenal are back to their terrible best following the 3-0 defeat at Crystal Palace, Wayne Rooney is hoping Manchester United fail to finish in the top four in the Premier League, and AC Milan ran out of paint but decided to launch their new kit anyway. Oh, and there’s a delicious goal from a different dimension on Football Manager and Phil Jones has given a revealing interview.

Content_title: Crystal Palace 3-0 Arsenal: Visitors’ top four hopes in Premier League hit by heavy defeat at Selhurst Park
Contents: Premier League, Selhurst Park – Crystal Palace 3 (Mateta 16’, Ayew 23’, Zaha 74’ pen) Arsenal 0

Content_title: ‘His evolution is insane!’ – How Manchester United target Christopher Nkunku became one of Europe’s best goalscorers
Contents: After his stellar performance in the Europa League, helping RB Leipzig to reach the semi-finals, Pete Sharland takes a closer look at Christopher Nkunku. Content_title: Premier League result - Manchester City move six points clear with easy win over derby rivals United
Contents: Premier League, Etihad Stadium - Manchester City 4 (De Bruyne 5', 28', Mahrez 68', 90') Manchester United 1 (Sancho 22')

Content_title: Paul Scholes: Manchester United should target Harry Kane, not Jadon Sancho
Contents: Paul Scholes says Manchester United lack a prolific centre forward and should prioritise a move for Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane over Borussia Dortmund winger Jadon Sancho.

Content_title: Opinion: Liverpool have Alexis Sanchez to thank for more than just one reason if Champions League pursuit comes off
Contents: Alexis Sanchez and Lautaro Martinez were proving a handful for Liverpool at Anfield. Martinez scored a stunner to put Inter back in contention, but Sanchez then picked up a second yellow card moments later to swing the tie back in Liverpool’s favour. The Reds are through, just, and they’ll be grateful for the tricky tie if they manage to go all the way in the Champions League again.

Content_title: Football news: Marginalised Inter Milan striker Alexis Sanchez hints at exit in social media post - Paper Round
Contents: Alexis Sanchez may be on the way out at Inter Milan, with the Chilean forward frustrated at his lack of playing time. Barcelona have been offered the services of Yaya Toure, and they will keep Ronald Koeman as manager with few other options available. Elsewhere, Liverpool could freshen their squad with the addition of teenager Kacper Kozlowski.

Content_title: Borussia Dortmund rule out Man Utd move for Sancho before transfer window closes
Contents: After revealing there has been talk between the two clubs in the past, Borussia Dortmund sporting director Michael Zorc has ruled out Jadon Sancho leaving for Manchester United this transfer window, stating there will be no change in the coming days.

Content_title: Europa League: Arsenal drawn with Irish team Dundalk, Celtic to face AC Milan
Contents: After becoming just the third Irish side to ever qualify for Europe, Dundalk are in dreamland after being drawn with Arsenal in the Europa League group stages, while Celtic face the prospect of AC Milan in their group and Tottenham a trip to Bulgaria.

Content_title: West Ham and Eintracht Frankfurt set up a perfect Europa League semi-final - The Warm-Up
Contents: Champions League? No thank you. Europe's second and third competitions have been brilliant, and the semi-finals are perfectly balanced. West Ham and Rangers are in the middle of an old-fashioned European adventure, Eintracht Frankfurt have conquered Camp Nou, and the Europa Conference League has gone from joke competition to extremely important trophy in just a single season.

Content_title: Jadon Sancho bungle would be just another Ed Woodward mistake
Contents: Reports that Ed Woodward has cost Manchester United the signing of Borussia Dortmund’s Jadon Sancho is a reminder that the executive vice-chairman has form for failing in negotiations.

Content_title: Real Madrid, Manchester United... Arsenal? Where will Aaron Ramsey go next?
Contents: The appointment of Andrea Pirlo as Juventus boss has reportedly pushed Aaron Ramsey towards an exit from the Italian champions, but where could he go next?

Content_title: Bruno Fernandes scores in big game (for once!), Cristiano Ronaldo and Portugal off to World Cup – The Warm-Up
Contents: Oh Serge! England’s ensemble of misfits’ hopes of a serious audition against Ivory Coast ahead of the World Cup were derailed by Aurier’s red card during the first half. Bruno Fernandes helped Portugal survive the play-offs as they felled giant-killers North Macedonia. And Christian Eriksen is not only playing again but scoring – it’s two in two for the Dane at international level!

Content_title: Paul Pogba in line for shock Premier League transfer away from Manchester United - Paper Round
Contents: Manchester United midfielder Paul Pogba could make a shock switch to another Premier League club with Aston Villa and Newcastle 'monitoring' his situation. Declan Rice is said to be more keen on moving to Chelsea than United, and Harry Kane has done little to cool speculation on his future at Tottenham.

Content_title: Paul Parker: Gareth Bale is not a Jose Mourinho player
Contents: Former Manchester United and England full-back Paul Parker is not convinced Jose Mourinho is the right manager for Gareth Bale, but says the reported deal would wake Tottenham fans up after a dismal time of late in the Premier League.

Content_title: West Ham sign Czech midfielder Soucek on loan from Slavia Prague
Contents: LONDON, Jan 29 (Reuters) - Relegation-threatened West Ham United have signed Czech midfielder Tomas Soucek on loan from Slavia Prague with an option on a permanent transfer, the Premier League club said on Wednesday.

Content_title: Football news - Lionel Messi rebellion must still be catalyst for Barcelona rebuild
Contents: The 33-year-old has decided to stay at the Camp Nou, but the Catalans must still treat this as a wake up call.

Content_title: Wolves 2-3 Leeds: Last-gasp Luke Ayling goal seals visitors a dramatic comeback victory to ease relegation fears
Contents: Premier Laegue, Molineux - Wolves 2 (Jonny 26', Trincao 45+11') Leeds 3 (Harrison 63', Rodrigo 66', Ayling 90+1')

Content_title: Europa League, Conference League round-up: Roma grab late win over Vitesse, Rangers through to Europa League quarters
Contents: Jose Mourinho enjoyed a dramatic equaliser from Tammy Abraham to send his Roma side through the quarter-finals of the Europa Conference League, while Rangers are into the next round of the Europa League as they secured a 4-2 victory over Serbian side Red Star Belgrade, giving Giovanni van Bronckhorst a lift early in his tenure.

Content_title: Everton lose at home to Wolves, Leeds beat Norwich and Andriy Yarmolenko scores in West Ham win
Contents: Wolves piled more misery on Everton who are now outside of the relegation zone in the Premier League on goal difference. Watford drew level on points with Frank Lampard's Toffees thanks to a 2-1 win on the road at Southampton. Leeds boosted their chances of staying up thanks to a dramatic win over Norwich.

Content_title: FA Cup draw - National League North side Kidderminster Harriers to face West Ham United, Boreham Wood get Bournemouth
Contents: The lowest-ranked team in the FA Cup, National League North side Kidderminster Harriers will face Premier League side West Ham United in round four. Boreham Wood travel to Bournemouth and League One side Cambridge United, who humbled Newcastle in round three, are rewarded with a trip to Luton. The fourth-round fixtures are due to take place between Friday, February 4 and Monday, February 7.

Content_title: Tottenham survive FA Cup scare to beat Morecambe, West Ham see off Leeds, Daniel Podence stars as Wolves beat Blades
Contents: The FA Cup third round is ripe for shocks and there was a big one on Saturday as Cambridge United beat Newcastle United 1-0 at St James' Park. Tottenham Hotspur were in danger of following the Magpies out at the hands of Morecambe, but their big guns came up trumps with late goals to secure their passage.

Content_title: Sign Raheem Sterling, possession obsession and restore relationships: How Xavi would remould Barcelona - Inside Football
Contents: Xavi Hernandez looks set to return to Barcelona as the first-team coach. In his latest Inside Football column, Dean Jones details how the club’s former captain plans to remould the club. Finances are tight, so his first point of order will be a return to possession-based football. Next, Xavi will address player relations. Finally, the club will get creative in the transfer market.

Content_title: Brendan Rodgers top choice to replace Ole Gunnar Solskjaer as Manchester United boss - report
Contents: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer will take on Tottenham Hotspur this weekend knowing that a loss could cost him his job, with the United hierarchy understood to be looking at potential replacements for the Norwegian. Following the 5-0 defeat to Liverpool, Solskjaer's days at the club look numbered, and ESPN are reporting that Brendan Rodgers is the preferred option take over, leapfrogging Antonio Conte

Content_title: Euro 2020 friendlies - Ciro Immobile and Lorenzo Insigne both score as Italy hammer Czech Republic
Contents: Internationals Friendlies, Stadio Renato Dall'Ara - Italy 4 (Immobile 23', Barella 42', Insigne 68', Berardi 73') Czech Republic 0

Content_title: Football news - Spain and Portugal coast to friendly stalemate ahead of Euro 2020
Contents: Estadio Wanda Metropolitano, International Friendly - Spain 0 Portugual 0

Content_title: Football news - Karim Benzema: It would be ideal for Kylian Mbappe to join Real Madrid if he wants to leave PSG
Contents: Recalled French international striker Karim Benzema has had the chance to finally play with Kylian Mbappe after the pair trained together on international duty for France. Speaking in an interview, he said that he hopes that the young striker would join Real Madrid quickly if he decided to leave Paris Saint-Germain.

Content_title: Lionel Messi: I take responsibility for my mistakes, but I only wanted a better Barcelona
Contents: After coming close to leaving Barcelona in the summer, Lionel Messi says he "takes responsibility for my mistakes" and was only trying to make a "better and stronger Barca". Messi handed in a transfer request but ended up staying after acknowledging it was “impossible” for any team to pay his £624m release clause.

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp: Liverpool boss confident Thiago, Matip will be fit to play Inter Milan in the Champions League last 16
Contents: Jurgen Klopp says he hopes to be able to have Thiago Alcantara in his squad to play Inter Milan in the Champions League on Tuesday night. The Liverpool boss also says the Premier League title race would have been handed to Manchester City in February in the past four seasons if it was not for Liverpool. City and Liverpool have shared the past four Premier League titles.

Content_title: Manchester United: Luka Jovic, Edinson Cavani interest Premier League club in search of a striker
Contents: Manchester United are looking to bring in a new striker before the October 5 deadline with Luka Jovic and Edinson Cavani top of their transfer list, according to reports in Spain and Italy.

Content_title: Serie A on the brink of shutdown after Covid-19 cases grow, with 14 positive tests at Genoa
Contents: Reports in Italy suggest Serie A could be suspended for two weeks in a bid to control growing numbers of Covid-19 cases. The news comes after 14 Genoa players tested positive for the virus on Sunday while AC Milan forward Zlatan Ibrahimovic has also tested positive.

Content_title: Ten positive in latest Premier League Covid-19 tests; Serie A side Genoa report 14 cases
Contents: The Premier League reveal 10 people have returned positive results in its latest round of COVID-19 tests. Meanwhile, over in Italy 15 team members and staff of Serie A side Genoa have now tested positive for COVID-19, the club said in a statement on Monday.

Content_title: Virgil van Dijk among positive Covid cases at Liverpool, but Newcastle match will go ahead
Contents: "Fabinho, Curtis Jones and Virgil van Dijk will miss tonight's Premier League fixture against Newcastle United after registering suspected positive tests for Covid-19," read a statement on Liverpool's website. Liverpool are seeking to close the gap on leaders Manchester City when they face Eddie Howe's side later on Thursday.

Content_title: 'Man Utd get more penalties than Liverpool, that's a fact' - Jurgen Klopp fires back at Ole Gunnar Solskjaer
Contents: Solskjaer claimed that previous comments by Klopp had influenced referees and caused Manchester United to be given fewer penalties. Klopp had orginally highlighted a higher rate of penalties won for Solskjaer's side in January, but insisted he did not have the power to impact decisions made by officials, defending his comments.

Content_title: Signing Willian for two years makes sense for Arsenal, but three years could prove costly
Contents: Signing a player of Willian's calibre on a free is something that would appeal to many an Arsenal fan, but giving the Brazilian a three-year deal could be foolish, writes Pete Hall.

Content_title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says he still wants to bring Fulham starlet Fabio Carvalho to Anfield
Contents: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says he still wants to sign Fulham's Fabio Carvalho but that he "doesn't know" what will happen regarding another bid. The Reds came in for the 19-year-old during the January transfer window, but failed to get the deal over the line. Klopp also revealed star forwards Mo Salah and Sadio Mane may be available for Thursday's game with Leicester City after AFCON duty.

Content_title: Jurgen Klopp is right, of course Man City's match with Liverpool will not decide the Premier League title
Contents: Manchester City’s match with Liverpool on Sunday is being billed as a Premier League title decider, but Jurgen Klopp does not think that’s the case. Both teams will have seven matches remaining after the Etihad encounter, so of course the Liverpool boss is right, with plenty of obstacles in the way – from sides chasing European places, to exploits in other competitions.

Content_title: ‘No more excuses’ – What Villarreal loss means for Bayern Munich and Julian Nagelsmann
Contents: A 2-1 aggregate loss to Spanish side Villarreal saw 2020 winners Bayern Munich exit the Champions League at the quarter-final stage. Despite it being his first season in charge at the club, it's still a disappointing show from Julian Nagelsmann, who promised much when he touched down in Bavaria. Eurosport Germany's Marc Hlusiak assess what this all means for the manager going forward.

Content_title: 'Nothing is decided' - Paul Pogba still waiting on future choice but boosted by linking up with France
Contents: Paul Pogba could be on the move away from Manchester United on a free transfer in the summer. He says no decision  has been made, but is sad about not challenging for honours with the Red Devils. ". I want to win trophies, to play for something.  In recent years, we haven't won any trophies, that is what's sad."

Content_title: Luke Shaw hints at unhappiness at Manchester United after saying he 'always feels wanted' with England
Contents: Luke Shaw has hinted at his unhappiness at Manchester United after saying he "always feels wanted" with England following his goalscoring contribution to his country's 2-1 win over Switzerland at Wembley. Shaw has been in and out of the team at Old Trafford under Ralf Rangnick, and his comments are just the latest in a long line of murmurs of discontent at the turbulent club.

Content_title: Harry Kane penalty gives England come from behind win over Switzerland at Wembley
Contents: International Friendly, Wembley – England 2 (Shaw 46’, Kane P 78’) Switzerland 1 (Embolo 22’)

Content_title: Chelsea bidders given April 11 deadline to submit final offers to buy club after Roman Abramovich sale decision
Contents: The process to buy Chelsea in light of Roman Abramovich's decision to sell the club continues apace. The deadline for final offers to be made by the shortlisted parties has been set for April 11 and there is hope a new owner could be in place before the end of the month. The UK government will have to ratify the proposal.

Content_title: CD Alcoyano 1-3 Real Madrid - Carlo Ancelotti's side avoid second successive cup shock against third tier side
Contents: Copa del Rey - CD Alcoyano 1 (Vega) Real Madrid 3 (Militao, Asensio, Jose Juan OG)

Content_title: Manchester United pay their players a lot of money according to French publication L'Equipe - The Warm-Up
Contents: It appears there is not a linear relationship between lavish spending and success. In related news, Manchester United reportedly pay four of the five highest wages in the Premier League. Real Madrid's bad week just got worse with another defeat against Barcelona, this time in the Champions League. And Tottenham are the latest club to put their weight behind the Hillsborough Law Now campaign.

Content_title: Gareth Southgate explains reasoning behind omission of Marcus Rashford and Jadon Sancho from England squad
Contents: The Three Lions boss is hopeful that Rashford will rediscover his best form and says the door is open for him force his way back into contention after a disappointing season with the Red Devils.  Manchester City’s Kyle Walker, Tottenham’s Eric Dier and AC Milan’s Fikayo Tomori were among the other notable omissions from Southgate’s squad. There was also a first call-up for Marc Guehi.

Content_title: Christian Eriksen scores stunner for Denmark against Serbia on return to scene of Euro 2020 cardiac arrest
Contents: Christian Eriksen scored on his return to the Parken Stadium for Denmark, 290 days after he suffered a cardiac arrest at the same ground during Euro 2020. Brentford midfielder Eriksen was handed the armband for the home friendly against Serbia on Tuesday, and found the net again, three days after he scored in a friendly against the Netherlands.

Content_title: Luis Enrique could 'turn things around very quickly' at Manchester United if he leaves Spain - Inside Europe
Contents: The Spain boss is the latest name being touted to take over at United as the club look to appoint a new manager this summer. Following a hugely successful tenure at Barcelona which included a Champions League win, Enrique most recently led his country to the Euro 2020 semis. Eurosport Spain’s Andres Weiss gives us the inside track on Enrique’s immediate future and what it could mean for United.

Content_title: 'Money won't win you the Champions League' - Thiago Silva sends PSG message over lavish spending
Contents: Chelsea defender Thiago Silva says it's "the same every year" at Paris Saint-Germain and that they have to stop "starting from scratch" each season if they want to finally win the Champions League. European football's elite competition has been PSG president Nasser El-Khelaifi's holy grail for a number of years, but Silva questioned whether their current methods will get them there.

Content_title: 'You'll have me all year long' - Sergio Aguero committed to Barcelona but debut delayed by leg injury
Contents: "The Argentine striker has a right calf injury and will undergo more tests to find out the exact extent of the injury." Barcelona confirmed in a statement that Sergio Aguero, who joined the club on a free transfer in the summer, had picked up a leg injury and he will not be able to make his debut in the Joan Gamper Trophy against Juventus.

Content_title: Football news - Barcelona's Sergio Aguero facing 10 weeks out with injury as Lionel Messi departs for PSG
Contents: Less than 24 hours after Lionel Messi's tearful press conference to confirm his departure, Barcelona have been hit by the news that striker Sergio Aguero is facing 10 weeks out with injury. Aguero, 33, joined from Manchester City as a free agent but may not play for his new club until October as he looks to get back to fitness.

Content_title: Barcelona 4-2 Real Sociedad: Braithwaite stars as Barca begin post-Messi era with big win
Contents: La Liga, Nou Camp: Barcelona 4 (Pique 19', Braithwaite 45+2', 59', Sergi 90+1'), Real Sociedad 2 (Lobete 82', Oyarzabal 85')

Content_title: Real Madrid are magic, it's the only explanation, after sneaking past Chelsea in Champions League - The Warm-Up
Contents: There is no logical or rational way to make sense of Real Madrid, or of that Luka Modric pass, so let's be honest: they're using magic. Strange and wonderful magic. Meanwhile Villarreal are doing their homework, and so, for once, are Manchester United – and that’s very good news for one forgotten man. Plus we celebrate the 20th anniversary of Bend It Like Beckham.

Content_title: Lyon reject second Houssem Aouar bid from Arsenal - reports
Contents: Arsenal have had a bid of 38 million euros for playmaker Houssem Aouar turned down by Lyon, according to French media group RMC. The 22-year-old is reportedly wanted by Arsenal and Manchester City.

Content_title: Manchester United: Most fortunate of victories at Brighton masks another substandard display
Contents: After allowing 18 shots to be fired at their goal and the woodwork saving them a record five times, rarely has a result given such a false representation of the action, with the most fortuitous of 3-2 victories at Brighton raising more questions than answers as to where Manchester United are at, writes Pete Hall.

Content_title: Real Madrid begin legal action against La Liga and CVC, Javier Tebas criticises Florentino Perez's 'threatening method'
Contents: Real Madrid announced on Tuesday that the club had begun legal proceedings against La Liga president Javier Tebas over the proposed deal with CVC partners. Real and rivals Barcelona both oppose the agreement, which would see €2.7 billion injected into Spanish football for a 10 per cent stake in the league.

Content_title: Football news - Lionel Messi breaks down in tears as he bids farewell to Barcelona in emotional press conference
Contents: Lionel Messi spoke to reporters at the Camp Nou after it was announced he would leave Barcelona after 17 years at the La Liga club. The 34-year-old is widely believed to be close to signing for Paris Saint-Germain amid Barca's financial troubles which prevented Messi from renewing his contract with them.

Content_title: Opinion: Paul Pogba's depression discussion should force change in how we view sports stars
Contents: "All top athletes go through these moments but few talk about it. Inevitably, you will feel it [depression] in your body, in your head, and you may have a month, even a year, where you are not well." Paul Pogba has opened up about his struggles with mental health and Ibrahim Mustapha looks at when we should temper our demands of sports stars as a result.

Content_title: Sadio Mane v Mohamed Salah II, Nigeria-Ghana rivalry renewed, Dark Horses clash: Africa's World Cup playoffs
Contents: As qualification for the 2022 reaches its climax, Africa is yet to decide which five teams will represent the continent in Qatar. The playoffs to decide which teams will head to the tournament are upon us with some tantalising matches thrown up that will see old scores settled and long-standing rivalries renewed.

Content_title: El Clasico: Eternal rivals Real Madrid and Barcelona united by shift towards smarter transfer strategy
Contents: Ahead of the Clasico Pete Sharland looks at the contrasting transfer strategies of the two Spanish giants and why there is now a sudden unification in the way the two teams go about their business. There will always remain fundamental, institutional differences but, dare we say it, are both teams now being (mostly) sensible?

Content_title: Champions League final moved from St Petersburg to Paris amid Russia invasion of Ukraine
Contents: UEFA called an extraordinary meeting of its executive committee to discuss the ongoing situation in Ukraine, with the Russian city of St Petersburg now stripped of the right to host the 2022 Champions League final. The Stade de France will instead host European football’s showpiece occasion, the first time Paris has hosted the final since 2006.

Content_title: European football faces up to its Gazprom problem as Russia-Ukraine crisis continues - The Warm-Up
Contents: Russia will lose the Champions League final this morning, but UEFA have a lot more to think about when it comes to Russian money in football. On the pitch, Barcelona had a very good time against Napoli, Rangers held on to defeat Borussia Dortmund, and Arsenal waited until the very last second to triumph over Wolves.

Content_title: Manchester United cut sponsorship agreement with Russian airline Aeroflot after Ukraine invasion
Contents: Aeroflot have had a relationship with United since 2013, when the airline became one of the club’s global partners. United have regularly used Aeroflot planes, but it is understood that a different carrier was used to take the Red Devils to and from their Champions League Round of 16 first leg tie away at Atletico Madrid.

Content_title: Manchester United launch audacious attempt to sign Chelsea's N'Golo Kante - Paper Round
Contents: Manchester United could complete the surprise signing of N'Golo Kante, Manchester City respond to their Leicester loss by recruiting a new centre-back, Tottenham Hotspur continue their search for a striker as back-up for Harry Kane and Chelsea attempt to sign former academy product Declan Rice from West Ham United. It's Monday's Paper Round...

Contents: Premier League, Amex Stadium - Brighton & Hove Albion 2 (N. Maupay 40'(p.), March 90')  Manchester United 3 (Dunk 43'(o.g.) Rashford 55, Fernandes 90)

Contents: Premier League, Turf Moor - Burnley 0 Liverpool 1 (Fabinho 40')
