Contents: Premier League, Tottenham Hotspur Stadium - Tottenham 0 Wolves 2 (Jimenez, 6' Dendoncker 18')

Content_title: Kurt Zouma pulls out of West Ham's Premier League game at Leicester City with illness in warm-up
Contents: Kurt Zouma has pulled out of West Ham's Premier League game at Leicester City with illness. The France defender has been under the spotlight of late after footage appeared online of him kicking his pet cat. Boss David Moyes had stood by the 27-year-old despite the incident. Zouma was reported to be experiencing problems with his vision in the warm-up, leading to his withdrawal.

Content_title: Man Utd news: Resentment, a ‘teacher’s pet’, Cristiano Ronaldo one of 16 players facing uncertain futures - Paper Round
Contents: The fallout from Manchester United’s defeat to Manchester City continues, and it dominates Tuesday’s Paper Round with the Manchester Evening News claiming “resentment remains rife” over team selection, while The Sun claim Cristiano Ronaldo only complained of injury after learning he was benched before then flying to Portugal. 16 players reportedly face uncertain futures at the club.

Content_title: Mauricio Pochettino to Man Utd gathers steam, but PSG stint is damaging the head coach’s reputation – Inside Europe
Contents: Reports in England suggest Paris Saint-Germain head coach Mauricio Pochettino is edging closer to a summer move to Manchester United, but what is the view from France after PSG’s cup defeat to Nice? Eurosport France’s Cyril Morin gives us the lowdown, and explains why the Argentine is not the only man who could lose his job at PSG.

Content_title: ‘Mohamed Salah doesn’t impress me’ – Cameroon striker Vincent Aboubakar stokes fire ahead of Afcon semi-final
Contents: Perhaps not the wisest of moves from Vincent Aboubakar, who ahead of Cameroon’s Africa Cup of Nations semi-final with Egypt has claimed Mohamed Salah “doesn’t impress” him, adding the Liverpool forward is not at Kylian Mbappe’s level. Follow live text commentary of Cameroon v Egypt tonight on Eurosport.co.uk.

Content_title: Ashley Cole joins Frank Lampard’s coaching team at Everton as former Chelsea teammates link up once more
Contents: Ashley Cole won eight major trophies alongside Frank Lampard at Chelsea and then played under his former England teammate at Derby County. Now the pair have reunited at Everton, with Cole joining as first-team coach after Lampard was appointed as the club’s new manager of Monday. “He is now a well-respected coach which has been recognised by his work with England Under-21s,” Lampard said.

Content_title: Ralf Rangnick wants Manchester United players to talk to him rather than vent on social media like Anthony Martial
Contents: “It's always better. I never ever read or communicate by those social media accounts." Manchester United boss Ralf Rangnick is keen to avoid more comments on social media like those from Jesse Lingard and Anthony Martial that seem to contradict his words. Watch every moment of Olympic Winter Games Beijing 2022 on discovery+

Content_title: Manchester United boss Ralf Rangnick says there is no rift between him and midfielder Jesse Lingard
Contents: Manchester United boss Ralf Rangnick says there is no rift between him and Jesse Lingard despite the pair appearing to disagree on the midfielder's availability. Rangnick said that Lingard had requested time off after not getting a move away from the club in January, but the 29-year-old disputed those claims. Rangnick says Lingard will be available for Tuesday night's game with Burnley.

Content_title: Robert Lewandowski transfer from Bayern Munich to Barcelona a possibility, but no deal agreed yet
Contents: Bayern will only let Robert Lewandowski leave should they find an adequate replacement. The striker has continued his sensational goalscoring form this season after netting 46 goals in 40 matches across all competitions. His consistent deadly form in front of goal has seen the Pole win the Best FIFA Men’s Player award in 2020 and 2021.

Content_title: Bayern Munich's Robert Lewandowski says the FIFA Best award is better than the Ballon d'Or
Contents: Bayern Munich's Robert Lewandowski reckons the FIFA Best award he has won for the past two years is better than the Ballon d'Or, which he controversially lost out on in 2021 to PSG's Lionel Messi. Football's elite stars regularly claim they are unbothered about individual awards, but Lewandowski's comments offer a window into the intense rivalry between the game's very best players.

Content_title: Gerard Pique to Erling Haaland: If you want the Ballon d'Or, do not join the same team as Kylian Mbappe
Contents: Forthright as ever, Gerard Pique has told Erling Haaland that if he wants to win the Ballon d'Or, then he shouldn't join the same team as Kylian Mbappe. Haaland and Mbappe are both rumoured to be on the move this summer, with Real Madrid in pole position to land Mbappe. Haaland's destination seems less clear, so could Pique's statement be cryptic advice that the Norwegian should join Barcelona?

Content_title: Liverpool and Man City’s final Premier League fixtures analysed as Kevin De Bruyne admits ‘schedule is tough’
Contents: Nothing could separate Manchester City and Liverpool on Sunday, with the Premier League’s top two playing out a thrilling 2-2 draw. Twice City led, through Kevin De Bruyne and Gabriel Jesus, but twice Liverpool responded after goals from Diogo Jota and Sadio Mane. With seven games left, City lead Liverpool by one point in the table.

Content_title: Kevin De Bruyne breaks Atletico Madrid resistance and gives Manchester City crucial first leg lead
Contents: Champions League Quarter-Final First Leg, Etihad Stadium – Manchester City 1 (De Bruyne 69’) Atletico Madrid 0

Content_title: Tuchel criticises Chelsea frontline after Blues' 1-0 defeat to Manchester City leaves them 13 points adrift
Contents: "Romelu Lukaku had many ball losses without any pressure, many ball losses in very promising circumstances. He had a huge chance. We want to serve him, but he is part of the team, and the performance up front, particularly in the first half, we can do much, much better" - Thomas Tuchel criticises Chelsea striker after 1-0 defeat to Manchester City

Content_title: Thomas Tuchel fears Chelsea will "get hammered" by Real Madrid in their second leg if they do not improve quickly.
Contents: A Karim Benzema hat-trick saw the Spanish giants leave Stamford Bridge with a 3-1 lead from the first leg of their Champions League quarter-final, leaving Chelsea on the brink of losing their status as champions of Europe. An error-shrewn performance left manager Thomas Tuchel angry, and he says unless they improve quickly his team could face an embarrassing evening at the Bernabeu next week.

Content_title: Karim Benzema's completely ridiculous one-man show at Chelsea - The Warm-Up
Contents: Two headers - one great, one incredible - and a defensive mix-up gave Benzema another hat-trick and Real Madrid an almost insurmoutable lead. Chelsea, for their part, were a complete shambles. The same is true of Everton, who threw away their six-pointer and are now in proper trouble. And it looks like Manchester United's manager race is run, for the moment.

Content_title: Villarreal 1-0 Bayern Munich: Arnaut Danjuma scores the only goal as Villarreal take narrow first leg lead.
Contents: Champions League, Estadio de la Ceramica: Villarreal 1 (Danjuma 8), Bayern Munich 0

Content_title: Manchester United set for summer shake-up amid Cristiano Ronaldo’s ‘uncertain’ future, working to sign Kalvin Phillips
Contents: Manchester United will undergo even more change this summer as big names prepare to depart Old Trafford. However, the Red Devils are planning to try and sign England international Kalvin Phillips from fierce rivals Leeds United and will attempt to keep Marcus Rashford at the club, despite interest from abroad. Elsewhere, Everton plan to stick with Frank Lampard in their battle against relegation.

Content_title: Cristiano Ronaldo, Robert Lewandowski, Lionel Messi... Neymar? Is the Qatar World Cup their swansong?
Contents: Cristiano Ronaldo, Robert Lewandowski, Lionel Messi and Neymar are four of the biggest names in world football but by the time the 2026 World Cup comes around in Canada, America and Mexico, it could be a tournament too far for the forwards. We look at the chances of them featuring beyond the Qatar World Cup.

Content_title: Jadon Sancho is 'in a vulnerable position' at Manchester United, according to Rio Ferdinand
Contents: Jadon Sancho has been the victim of a Manchester United team still trying to find its identity, believes Rio Ferdinand. The ex-United defender reckons Sancho is - as a consequence - in a 'vulnerable position' at the club. Sancho's stats this season say everything about his lack of impact, with just one goal in 17 appearances. United face Burnley in the Premier League on Tuesday night.

Content_title: Jack Grealish and Phil Foden warned about their conduct by Pep Guardiola after reportedly visiting a nightclub
Contents: Jack Grealish has scored three goals for Manchester City this season while Foden has scored five. Neither player started in City’s emphatic victory against Newcastle on Sunday and Pep Guardiola has said his team selection for the game was not to rotate his players. The Telegraph report Guardiola was unimpressed by the duo's physical condition when they reported for training on Wednesday.

Content_title: Christian Eriksen: Danish midfielder stable, transferred to hospital after collapsing on pitch at Euro 2020
Contents: The Danish midfielder is reportedly stable after collapsing three minutes before half-time during his country’s match against Finland. Eriksen was down for a number of minutes and was shielded by his team-mates as medical staff worked to resuscitate him and he has now been taken to hospital in Copenhagen.

Content_title: Manchester City season preview: Big demands on Jack Grealish and the striker role needs filling
Contents: Eurosport is taking a look at each of the Premier League’s Big Six ahead of the new season and this time we’re taking a look at the current title holders Manchester City. With Jack Grealish now at the club and legendary striker Sergio Aguero no longer there, can City defend their title? And what about the Champions League?

Content_title: Euro 2020 news - Harry Kane's extra-time goal sends England into final and breaks Danish hearts
Contents: Euro 2020 semi-final, Wembley – England 2 (Kjaer OG 39’, Kane 104’) Denmark 1 (Damsgaard 30’)

Content_title: Euro 2020 - 'I'm not bothered!' - Gareth Southgate reveals Jack Grealish's reaction to shock substitution in extra-time
Contents: Gareth Southgate has played down questions about why Jack Grealish was substituted in extra-time against Denmark. Grealish was introduced with 20 minutes left in normal time but was then hooked after Harry Kane put England in front in extra-time. “In the end Jack said: ‘I’m not really bothered we made the final!’ He had the impact we wanted in the game," Southgate said about the call.

Content_title: England ratings & analysis v Denmark: Three Lions come of age as Raheem Sterling dominates again
Contents: England saw off the challenge of Denmark 2-1 after extra time to set up a final against Italy on Sunday. Raheem Sterling was again the standout player for England and Harry Kane scored to move to withing one goal of the Golden Boot on a joyous night at Wembley.

Content_title: Euro 2020 news - England set up the perfect Euro 2020 final against Italy on Sunday - The Warm-Up
Contents: The two best teams in Euro 2020 are going to face off for the trophy, and it will be the ideal game to end a wonderful tournament. Particularly now that we know that Gareth Southgate is a cold-blooded genius.

Content_title: Football news: Barcelona struggle to ditch scandal-hit Antoine Griezmann to raise funds - Paper Round
Contents: Barcelona need to raise funds and Antoine Griezmann is their best choice for a player to sell, but it won't be easy. Elsewhere, Manchester United want to sign both Leon Goretzka from Bayern Munich and Raphael Varane from Real Madrid. Houssem Aouar remains a target for fellow Premier League side Arsenal.

Content_title: Manchester City praised for keeping their focus in heated Champions League battle against Atletico Madrid.
Contents: Bloodied heads, fierce tackles and brawls between players were all present as Manchester City booked a semi-final tie with Real Madrid. Real's city rivals were full of aggression but were unable to overturn a 1-0 deficit from the first leg, meaning Pep Guardiola's side progress to the last four of the competition. They hope to go one better than last season when they finished runners-up.

Content_title: Liverpool or Manchester City? It’s 2-2 close to call as Jurgen Klopp goes big on the boxing analogies – The Warm-Up
Contents: Manchester City two, Liverpool two, and a Premier League title race still too close to call. That was a lot of fun, that draw at the Etihad, and it had Jurgen Klopp rolling out the boxing analogies. Pep Guardiola got very excited too, did you see that slap-handshake? They go again on Saturday, to our delight, this time in the FA Cup semis.

Content_title: Meh United, the Premier League’s blockbuster is actually on Wednesday, and Pedri magic – The Warm-Up
Contents: Another weekend of Premier League action, another weekend where Manchester United failed to impress. Elsewhere, Tottenham strengthened their top-four hopes, Everton continued to look awful, and over in Europe there were goals for Lionel Messi, Neymar and Kylian Mbappe, while a bit of Pedri magic helped Barcelona move up to second. Lovely.

Content_title: Benfica 3-0 Barcelona - Benfica hammer sorry Barca to pile even more pressure on Ronald Koeman
Contents: Champions League Group E, Estadio da Luz – Benfica 3 (Nunez 3’, 79’ P, Silva 69’) Barcelona 0

Content_title: 'I am proud to wear the 10 after Leo' - Ansu Fati thrilled to take Barcelona number 10 jersey from Lionel Messi
Contents: “Thanks to the doctors and everyone who has been with me through all this,” Ansu Fati said following his return from injury against Levante in La Liga on Sunday. “And the fans who have been unbelievable. We are Barca and we have to aim to win everything - La Liga, Champions League, all the competitions. We have to fight and work for that.”

Content_title: Barcelona defender Ronald Araujo linked to Real Madrid free transfer in 2023 as contract talks stall
Contents: Real Madrid famously signed Luis Figo from Barcelona in acrimonious circumstances and now Florentino Perez could be back for another Catalan favourite. Central defender Ronald Araujo could be on his way to the Bernabeu on a free transfer in 2023 with Barcelona potentially set for another embarrassing contract failure.

Content_title: 'Xavi effect’ starting to be seen at Barcelona, despite Spanish Super Cup defeat to Real Madrid - Inside Europe
Contents: There were signs of improvement for Barcelona, despite Xavi’s side suffering a fifth straight defeat at the hands of fierce rivals Real Madrid. We spoke to Eurosport Spain’s Jorge Ordas to assess the reaction in both camps after the pair played out a five-goal El Clasico thriller at Saudi Arabia's King Fahd International Stadium.

Content_title: 'We will try our best' - Xavi Hernandez promises to use Europa League to improve Barcelona squad ahead of Napoli clash
Contents: "We will try to be at our best and we want to show that we are capable of competing in Europe" - Barcelona boss Xavi says he wants to use the Europa League to prove to the world that Barcelona belong in elite European competition again. The Catalan giants failed to qualify for the Champions League knockout stages for the first time in 20 years, but face Napoli for a spot in the Europa League

Content_title: ‘I thought it was nothing’ - Sergio Aguero discusses heart problem which forced early retirement
Contents: Having experienced discomfort in his chest during Barcelona’s 1-1 draw against Alaves in the autumn, Aguero was diagnosed with a cardiac arrhythmia and forced to announce his retirement in December. In a Twitch live stream, he has spoken about his thoughts following the Alaves game, his experience in hospital and how his new implant makes him feel like Iron Man.

Content_title: Champions League quarter-finals: Atletico Madrid defender Jose Gimenez ruled out of first leg against Manchester City
Contents: Atletico Madrid return to England for a crucial UEFA Champions League quarter-final first leg against Manchester City tomorrow night, but they will do so without defender Jose Gimenez. The Uruguayan left the field against Alaves in their most recent La Liga outing, and the club have now confirmed that he will play no part at the Etihad Stadium. Felipe is expected to play in his absence.

Content_title: 'There are new elements' - Kylian Mbappe provides Paris Saint-Germain future update amid Real Madrid links
Contents: “If I had taken a decision, I would have said so. I don't owe it to anyone, it’s a personal decision. If I make a decision, I say it.” The 23-year-old French superstar was speaking after his man of the match performance in a PSG's 5-1 win over Lorient in Ligue 1 and insisted nothing has been decided despite speculation over a possible move to Real Madrid.

Content_title: ‘World class’ Tottenham striker Harry Kane is ‘not normal’, says head coach Antonio Conte
Contents: Despite failing to find himself on the scoresheet yesterday afternoon, Harry Kane’s performance during Spurs’ 5-1 humbling of Newcastle United has been singled out by head coach Antonio Conte. The 28-year-old has been in fine recent form, with Conte admitting the “world-class striker” is setting a fantastic example for team-mates to follow.

Content_title: AC Milan striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic says he feels 'panic' at the thought of retiring from football
Contents: AC Milan striker Zlatan Ibrahimovic says he feels "panic" at the thought of retiring from football after 23 seasons in the game. Ibrahimovic, now 40, is still an evergreen presence up front for the Rossoneri despite his advancing years, scoring 33 goals since rejoining the club in 2020. But he is comforted at seeing the new generation - such as fellow Swede Anthony Elanga - breaking through.

Content_title: Napoli win on the road at Atalanta to keep up Serie A title pressure on AC Milan
Contents: Gewiss Stadium, Serie A - Atalanta 1 (De Roon 58' Napoli 2 (Insigne pen 14', Politano 37',  Elmas 81')

Content_title: Germany v Spain in the 2022 World Cup group stages - Inside Europe on how a mouth-watering contest could play out
Contents: Spain and Germany will meet on November 27 in what is a mouth-watering contest at the 2022 World Cup and could go some way to determine who will top Group E and, in theory, get a kinder draw in the round-of-16. We reached out to our colleagues in Europe to get an insight into how the match could play out.

Content_title: Former Real Madrid striker Fernando Morientes expects PSG star Kylian Mbappe to play for the club next season
Contents: ”Florentino Perez loves him, he loves Kylian because he is different. He is a player who can play many years in Madrid," Morientes said. Mbappe is out of contract at Paris Saint-Germain this summer and has been heavily linked with a move to Madrid. Former PSG star Zlatan Ibrahimovic said he has also urged Mbappe to go to the Spanish giants.

Content_title: AC Milan 0-0 Juventus: Zlatan Ibrahimovic injured as Milan are held by Juve to dent Serie A title hopes
Contents: Serie A, San Siro – AC Milan 0 Juventus 0

Content_title: Another woefully trophyless season at Manchester United, but viva Atletico ‘the Spanish Burnley’ Madrid – The Warm-Up
Contents: Manchester United are out of the Champions League, and with it their hopes of silverware are over for another year. This was largely down to an Atletico Madrid masterclass, with Diego Simeone getting pelters from the Old Trafford crowd as a result. Elsewhere, Chelsea’s turmoil continues and Barcelona change their stadium name (a bit).

Content_title: Ronald Koeman set to return as Netherlands boss after World Cup following Louis van Gaal's cancer diagnosis
Contents: Ronald Koeman is set to return as Netherlands boss after the 2022 World Cup following current manager Louis van Gaal's prostate cancer diagnosis. Van Gaal revealed his condition on Dutch TV last week, and though he will continue in his role until the Qatar showpiece, Koeman - who held the job between 2018 and 2020 - will take the Oranje helm thereafter.

Content_title: Juan Mata quashes retirement rumours, says he is 'ready to perform' for Manchester United despite lack of minutes
Contents: Juan Mata has silenced rumours that he could be set to call time on his playing career at the end of this season, stating instead that his mind is 100% committed to playing football despite making just five appearances for the Red Devils in 2021-22. United are searching for a new permanent manager and their identity could shape Mata's future and the role he has to play at Old Trafford

Content_title: 'Don't want to rule anything out' - Erik ten Hag on Manchester United links as Pep Guardiola says 'he could be the one'
Contents: Erik ten Hag's star continues to shine bright at Ajax and he is said to be one of the front runners to take charge of Manchester United when Ralf Rangnick steps aside at the end of the season. The Dutchman confirmed talks had taken place but that he remains fully focused on his duties with the Amsterdam club.

Content_title: Tottenham staff and squad return six positive coronavirus tests amid possible outbreak - reports
Contents: Tottenham Hotspur's staff and playing squad have reportedly returned six positive coronavirus test results. The results mean that Spurs' next three games - against Rennes, Brighton and then Leicester City - could face huge disruption as Antonio Conte looks to continue the club's resurgent form since his arrival.

Content_title: Slick Spurs close on Champions League places with Norwich win
Contents: Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, Premier League LIVE - Tottenham Hotspur 3 (Moura 10', Sanchez 67', Son 76') Norwich City 0

Content_title: Everton looking to sell Jordan Pickford with Tottenham interested in England goalkeeper – Paper Round
Contents: Monday’s Paper Round includes reports Rafael Benitez wants to sell Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford. There’s also the prospect of Willy Caballero moving to Southampton, while over in Spain there is a deadline for Ousmane Dembele to respond to Barcelona’s final contract extension proposal, and an update of Diego Simeone’s position at Atletico Madrid.

Content_title: Kylian Mbappe and Neymar score hat-tricks as PSG beat Clermont Foot to go 15 points clear in Ligue 1
Contents: Stade Gabriel Montpied, Ligue 1 - Clermont Foot 1 (Dossou 42') Paris Saint-Germain 6 (Neymar 6' 71' pen. 83' Mbappe 19' 74' 80')

Content_title: Sergio Ramos ruled out of PSG v Real Madrid Champions League last-16 clash, Neymar, Karim Benzema doubts
Contents: Paris Saint-Germain will be without defender Sergio Ramos when they take on Real Madrid in the first leg of a blockbuster last-16 Champions League tie this week. The 35-year-old has only played five games for PSG since joining from Real in the summer. There are also injury concerns over Neymar and Real striker Karim Benzema.

Content_title: Neymar returns to training ahead of his Paris Saint-Germain side facing Real Madrid in the Champions League
Contents: Neymar could be in contention to feature for Paris Saint-Germain against Real Madrid in the Champions League round of 16 on February 15. The Brazil star has been out with an ankle injury since November but returned to training on Thursday - just five days before the first leg clash between the two European heavyweights at the Parc des Princes. Sergio Ramos remains a doubt with his calf problem.

Content_title: Nations League - 'Nobody understands Luis Enrique's choices' - Why Spain is divided ahead of Italy clash
Contents: Despite leading Spain to the Euro 2020 semi-finals and Nations League Finals, Luis Enrique faces continued criticism for the make-up of his squad. Spain will play Italy at San Siro tonight without a recognised striker and with some in-form players left at home. We spoke to Eurosport Spain’s Félix Martin to get the latest.

Content_title: Arsenal confirm defender Kieran Tierney will miss rest of season ahead of left knee surgery
Contents: Arsenal have been dealt a blow as they attempt to nail down a spot in next season's Champions League tournament. They lost 3-0 to Crystal Palalce on Monday night and on Tuesday confirmed that their Scottish international defender Kieran Tierney is out for the rest of the season as he requires knee surgery.

Content_title: Mikel Arteta: We have to apologise to our fans after 3-0 defeat to Crystal Palace leaves top four finish in peril
Contents: Arsenal failed to show up against Crystal Palace on Monday night in their Premier League London derby and ended up losing 3-0, putting their Champions League hopes in danger. After a heavy defeat, Gunners boss Mikel Arteta was disappointed with the performance and offered an apology to his club's fans.

Content_title: Arsenal beaten by Wolfsburg in Women's Champions League quarter-finals after Jill Roord strike, Leah Williamson own goal
Contents: Volkswagen Arena, Women's Champions League quarter-final second leg: Wolfsburg 2 (Roord 9', Williamson OG 73') Arsenal 0 (Agg: 3-1)

Content_title: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta on Aaron Ramsdale, Bukayo Saka, Takehiro Tomiyasu and Santi Cazorla return
Contents: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has given fitness updates on Aaron Ramsdale, Bukayo Saka and Takehiro Tomiyasu ahead of the trip to Crystal Palace on Monday. Arteta also spoke about rumours that Santi Cazorla could return to the club in a coaching role. Arsenal are fourth in the Premier League, three points ahead of Tottenham and four ahead of Manchester United, having played a game less than both.

Content_title: ‘We really want it’- Mikel Arteta on Arsenal’s push for Premier League top four after Aston Villa victory
Contents: The Spaniard also singled out Bernd Leno for returning between the sticks in the absence of Aaron Ramsdale, and was delighted to give Emile Smith Rowe a full 90-minute run-out. “We had a lot of players with niggles that wanted to be here.” We lost Aaron and [Gabriel] Martinelli this week. We’re so pleased for Bernd as he’s not played the minutes that he’s used to in his career."

Content_title: 'I don’t forget this' - Antonio Conte bites back at Mikel Arteta after Arsenal boss' complaints about fixture list
Contents: Mikel Arteta hit out at the Premier League over Arsenal's fixture schedule, but those comments do not carry much weight with his Tottenham counterpart Antonio Conte who opted to remind the Gunners boss that his club requested to have the north London derby called off in January due to player absences.

Content_title: Special Report: The human cost of a Qatar World Cup
Contents: France Football's Philippe Auclair is bringing us a three-part special report into Qatar's controversial hosting of the 2022 World Cup. In the final part, he focuses on concerns over the conditions imposed on the migrant workers who will help build the stadia and infrastructure required for the FIFA tournament.

Content_title: 'Some issues you can’t hide away from' - Harry Kane conflicted about Qatar World Cup due to human rights issues
Contents: England are preparing for friendlies with Switzerland and Ivory Coast, and captain Harry Kane spoke to the media on Wednesday. The Tottenham star was asked for his views on Qatar's record on human rights and said the players and staff have been discussing the situation and will not shy away from raising awareness.

Content_title: So, Qatar 2022 is really happening then; World Cup draw takes centre stage – The Warm-Up
Contents: Ahead of today's World Cup draw, Gianni Infantino has been comparing himself and his mission to Mandela, Gandhi and the great peacemakers of history. As you do. But this hasn't stopped the questions about the World Cup and Qatar. On the pitch, Wolfsburg have earned themselves a Champions League semi-final against Barcelona. Gulp.

Content_title: World Cup draw: England need to be 'close to perfect' to win the tournament in Qatar, says Gareth Southgate
Contents: England boss Gareth Southgate has led England to a World Cup semi-final in Russia in 2018 and the Euro 2020 final at Wembley last summer. The 51-year-old believes he has a squad that are capable of winning their first World Cup since 1966 in Qatar later this year but thinks they will have to put in performances that are "as close as perfect" in order to do so.

Content_title: World Cup 2022: Forget England, here are FIVE actual dark horses for Qatar glory
Contents: From the man who brought you “Wales will win Euro 2016” and “Venezuela will definitely qualify for Qatar” comes the latest in the dark horses series. With this World Cup set to be the most open in ages, potentially ever, due to the unfamiliar scheduling, a host of outsiders will be looking to make their mark on football’s biggest stage. So who should you stick £1 on ahead of the draw?

Content_title: Raheem Sterling, Ollie Watkins, Tyrone Mings score as England beat 10-man Ivory Coast at Wembley
Contents: International friendly, Wembley Stadium: England 3 (Watkins 30', Sterling 45', Mings 90+3) Ivory Coast 0

Content_title: Newcastle United boss Eddie Howe unsure whether Kieran Trippier will return before end of season
Contents: After signing from Atletico Madrid for around £12m in January and impressing in his first few games for Eddie Howe’s side, Kieran Trippier picked up a foot injury in their 1-0 win against Aston Villa last weekend. Speaking ahead of Newcastle’s trip to West Ham on Saturday, Howe has admitted that he doesn’t know how long the England international will be on the sidelines.

Content_title: Gareth Southgate calls Harry Maguire boos from England fans during Ivory Coast win an 'absolute joke'
Contents: Manchester United defender Harry Maguire was booed by some England fans before and during the 3-0 friendly win over Ivory Coasy at Wembley. Manager Gareth Southgate was not impressed and said supporters should get behind the team. Raheem Sterling, Ollie Watkins and Tyrone Mings netted for the Three Lions as they continued to prepare for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar.

Content_title: Erik ten Hag favourite for Manchester United manager job ahead of Mauricio Pochettino – Paper Round
Contents: Manchester United have narrowed their manager search down to two candidates: Erik ten Hag and Mauricio Pochettino. Elsewhere, Barcelona are looking to take advantage of Chelsea's current woes by targeting a trio of the Blues' defenders, Newcastle United have put together an extended transfer shortlist and Leicester City could be set for a squad shake-up this summer.

Content_title: 'PSV had to do something, so they roll the dice on a club icon' – Inside Europe on Ruud van Nistelrooy
Contents: With the news that PSV have appointed club legend Ruud van Nistelrooy as their new manager, Pete Sharland gets in touch with Kevin van Nunen from Eurosport Netherlands to get the lowdown on the appointment. Is this the right move for both parties? Do we know what kind of manager Van Nistelrooy will be? And how have the fan reacted?

Content_title: Bruno Fernandes double sends Portugal to 2022 World Cup in Qatar at North Macedonia’s expense
Contents: Estadio do Dragao, World Cup Qualifiers, play-off final, Portugal 2 (B Fernandes 32', 65') North Macedonia 0

Content_title: Frank Lampard urges Everton players to ‘give every ounce’ in relegation battle after Burnley defeat
Contents: Everton are 17th in the Premier League table and just one point above Burnley, who beat the Toffees 3-2 in a relegation six-pointer on Wednesday night. Everton had led 2-1, but lost their sixth match in seven league games after Maxwel Cornet’s winner in the 85th minute at Turf Moor. Everton boss Frank Lampard said that if his players didn’t know they were already in trouble, they do now…

Content_title: Maxwell Cornet strikes to give Burnley thrilling win against relegation rivals Everton
Contents: Having not scored in their previous four Premier League matches, Burnley had to dig deep to find three goals to beat their fellow strugglers 3-2 in a breathless clash at Turf Moor. Two Richarlison penalties gave Everton the half time lead, but a raucous crowd urged their team to victory with Maxwell Cornet slamming home a late winner to spark belief that an escape from relegation is possible.

Content_title: Burnley 0-2 Manchester City: Kevin De Bruyne and Ilkay Gundoghan help City reclaim Premier League lead
Contents: Premier League, Turf Moor: Burnley 0, Manchester City 2 (De Bruyne 5’. Gundoghan 25’)

Content_title: Tottenham fight back to thrash Newcastle to boost top-four hopes
Contents: Tottenham Hotspur Stadium, Premier League - Tottenham 5 (Davies 43', Doherty 48', Son 54', Royal 64', Bergwijn 83') Newcastle 1 (Schar 39')

Content_title: Mapping out England's possible journey to the 2022 World Cup final on December 18 in Qatar
Contents: The draw has been made, England now know who their opponents in Group B will be (well, the majority of them!) and optimistic fans of the Three Lions can now start mapping out who they might meet in the knockout stages should Gareth Southgate's men get that far. A potential round-of-16 clash with the Netherlands is quite possible, but who after that?

Content_title: Why Manchester City v Liverpool deserves to be in the pantheon of great football rivalries
Contents: Ahead of the blockbuster clash on Sunday afternoon at the Etihad Stadium, Pete Sharland takes a look at Manchester City and Liverpool. Are these the two greatest Premier League sides ever? Have they created a duopoly? And if so, should that be a concern for fans of the competition? Plus, why won’t English football fans ever fully fall in love with Pep Guardiola and Jurgen Klopp?

Content_title: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp ‘the biggest rival I have had’ - Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola
Contents: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says Liverpool counterpart Jurgen Klopp is the biggest rival he has had in his management career, ahead of a game on Sunday which is being billed as a Premier League title decider. Klopp has also heaped praise on Guardiola - but the Spaniard denies he is the best coach in the world.

Content_title: ‘I know the rules’ - Frank Lampard accepts Everton sack speculation as club battle to avoid Premier League relegation
Contents: Everton manager Frank Lampard says he has “no problem” with speculation he could be sacked, with his club involved in a relegation battle in the Premier League. The former Chelsea and Derby boss is reported to be under pressure, just 10 weeks after he was appointed by the Merseysiders. Lampard says he is used to pressure, and called the rumours a “symptom of the Premier League”.

Content_title: Gareth Southgate ready to wait for Ukraine resolution as England uncertainty 'irrelevant'
Contents: England manager Gareth Southgate and United States coach Gregg Berhalter were in no rush to have Ukraine's potential involvement in the World Cup prematurely settled. Ukraine are yet to play Scotland in their play-off match due to the invasion by Russia, and Southgate said his own concerns with tournament were 'irrelevant' compared to the situation in Ukraine.

Content_title: England could face Scotland, Wales or Ukraine in World Cup Group B with United States and Iran
Contents: England face an uncertain preparation period for their World Cup Group B fixtures as they are only sure of two of their opponents. They will play Iran and the United States, but they must wait for the resolution of the tie between Scotland and Ukraine, who will have to go on to face Wales in the final playoff decider.

Content_title: What a job Xavi has done at Barcelona: From existential crisis to moaning about grass – The Warm-Up
Contents: Xavi was left moaning about the state of the pitch after Barcelona’s 1-1 draw with  Eintracht Frankfurt in their Europa League quarter-final first leg on Thursday. It is representative of the job he has done at the Camp Nou that the existential crisis he inherited seems a distant memory. West Ham have finally made themselves at home at the London Stadium, and 60-minute games could be a thing.

Content_title: RB Leipzig fight back to snatch draw against Atalanta
Contents: RB Arena, Europa League - RB Leipzig 1 (Zappacosta OG 59') Atalanta 1 (Muriel 17')

Contents: Allianz Arena, Champions League quarter-final second leg: Bayern Munich 1 (Lewandowski 52') Villarreal (Chukwueze 88') Aggregate: 1-2

Content_title: ‘He didn’t feel well’ - Wales hopeful Gareth Bale will be fit for crucial World Cup playoff against Austria
Contents: Gareth Bale has linked up with the Wales squad ahead of his country's crucial playoff semi-final against Austria, despite having little game time at club level. The 32-year-old has played just twice for Los Blancos since taking part in a 5-1 World Cup qualification victory over Belarus in November 2021.

Content_title: ‘It’s too early’ – Roberto Mancini 'too disappointed' to discuss future after North Macedonia loss
Contents: Italy have failed to qualify for the last two editions of the World Cup after their loss to North Macedonia in their World Cup qualification play-off semi-final, and manager Roberto Mancini says he is 'too disappointed' to discuss his future. The Azzurri won the World Cup in 2006 but were knocked out at the group stage in 2010 and 2014 and have failed to qualify for 2018 and 2022.

Content_title: La Liga news - Carlo Ancelotti praises Gareth Bale on Real Madrid return
Contents: Bale returned to la Liga action for the first time in 14 months in Real's opening day victory. The Welshman played 68 minutes before being replaced by Rodrygo. Ancelotti declared himself very happy with Bale's commitment and thinks he can be a top player for Real once more when he returns to full fitness.

Content_title: Italy 0-1 North Macedonia: Roberto Mancini’s side dumped out in huge shock after late Aleksander Trajkovski strike
Contents: World Cup qualification UEFA play-off semi-final, Stadio Renzo Barbera - taly 0 North Macedonia 1 (Trajkovski, 92)

Content_title: ‘Today there is great disappointment’ – Inside Europe on Italy’s failure to qualify for 2022 World Cup
Contents: After a catastrophic night for Italian football with the 1-0 loss to North Macedonia, Simone Eterno and Carlofilippo Vardelli from Eurosport Italy give their thoughts on the failure to reach the World Cup for the second time in a row. Plus there’s more on the future of manager Roberto Mancini less than a year after winning the European Championships.

Content_title: Football news - Real Madrid suffer title blow against Girona, Sergio Ramos sees red
Contents: La Liga, Bernabeu - Real Madrid 1 (Casemiro 25') Girona 2 (Stuani P 65', Portu 75')

Content_title: Football news - La Liga clubs free to start full training from Monday
Contents: Clubs in Spain's top two soccer divisions can hold full training sessions from Monday for the first time since returning to activity after action was halted in March due to the coronavirus pandemic, La Liga organisers have said.

Content_title: Football news - Messi prefers not to over-think risk of infection as La Liga return looms
Contents: Lionel Messi believes he is better off not thinking too much about the risk of being infected by the coronavirus as Spanish soccer clubs step up their return to activity, saying he looks forward to getting back to playing matches.

Content_title: Football news - Barcelona in crisis as six directors quit
Contents: Spanish La Liga champions Barcelona were in turmoil on Friday after six board directors resigned criticising the clubs's handling of a social media scandal and the financial implications of the coronavirus crisis.

Content_title: Erik Ten Hag: Manchester United speak to current Ajax boss as manager search hots up
Contents: Manchester United have spoken to current Ajax boss Erik Ten Hag about taking over as manager in the summer. Interim boss Ralf Rangnick is set to step down from his role when the season ends, and he is helping drive the search for his replacement. As well as Ten Hag, PSG boss Mauricio Pochettino and Spain head coach Luis Enrique are among other names in the frame.

Content_title: Erik ten Hag, Mauricio Pochettino, Julen Lopetegui or Luis Enrique - Who should replace Ralf Rangnick at Man Utd?
Contents: Erik ten Hag of Ajax, Mauricio Pochettino at Paris Saint-Germain, Sevilla's Julen Lopetegui and Spain boss Luis Enrique are all believed to be under consideration to take over from Ralf Rangnick at Manchester United this summer. We take a look at the pros and cons of plumping for one of the coaches.

Content_title: Paul Pogba reveals he has struggled with depression since fall-out with Jose Mourinho at Manchester United
Contents: Paul Pogba revealed that he has suffered depression during his career and that it began when working under Jose Mourinho at Manchester United. The pair famously failed to see eye-to-eye during the Portuguese's managerial tenure at Old Trafford, and the France star has revealed for the first time the toll that period took on him.

Content_title: 'He was second or third choice' - Ancelotti chases history with Real Madrid after proving doubters wrong - Inside Europe
Contents: Carlo Ancelotti saw his side pull off a stunning victory away from home against one of his former clubs, Chelsea, to put Real Madrid on the brink of another Champions League semi-final, having previously lifted the trophy with the club. Few expected Ancelotti to perform this well on his Bernabeu return and Felix Martin breaks down exactly how he has proved people wrong.

Content_title: Man City 2-2 Liverpool ‘like a boxing match’ says Jurgen Klopp as Pep Guardiola jokes ‘they are so annoying!’
Contents: Jurgen Klopp and Pep Guardiola were left dissecting a 2-2 draw that leaves Manchester City one point ahead of Liverpool in the Premier League table. Klopp said the match at the Etihad was like a boxing match, and ahead of another meeting in the FA Cup semi-finals next weekend, Guardiola joked Liverpool are “so annoying”.

Content_title: Ligue 1 - Avant le Classique PSG-OM : Recours à Payet, polyvalent, adapté : Gerson est enfin au niveau
Contents: LIGUE 1 - En difficulté en première partie de saison, Gerson a finalement réussi à trouver ses marques depuis cet hiver au sein du collectif hybride de Jorge Sampaoli. Passeur et buteur, le Brésilien commence à devenir un lieutenant adjoint idéal pour Dimitri Payet. Recruté pour 25 millions d'euros cet été, l'ancien joueur de Flamengo n'est pas passé loin d'être une erreur de casting.

Content_title: Ligue 1 - Avant PSG - OM - Lionel Messi, Neymar, Kylian Mbappé : Un grand match pour un petit pardon ?
Contents: LIGUE 1 – En feu depuis deux matches, la triplette Messi, Neymar, Mbappé va tester sa nouvelle entente face à l'OM. Si un gros match face à l'ennemi marseillais n'effacera pas les déceptions nées d'une saison ratée, il pourrait éclairer d'un jour nouveau l'aventure parisienne des deux Sud-Américains. C'est en tout cas, leur dernière occasion de briller dans un match qui compte.

Content_title: LIGUE 1 - PSG - OM / Mandanda titulaire ? Sampaoli n'a pas tranché : "J'ai de la reconnaissance pour Mandanda, mais..."
Contents: LIGUE 1 - Enorme jeudi en Coupe d'Europe, Steve Mandanda a enchaîné trois matches dans le but de Marseille. Sera-t-il titulaire à la place de Pau Lopez pour le choc face au PSG dimanche en Ligue 1 ? Jorge Sampaoli n'en a pas dit plus en conférence de presse ce samedi. Le suspense reste entier entre deux gardiens qui donnent pleinement satisfaction au coach argentin de l'OM.
